meanings.definition: To clean or scrub something vigorously.
meanings.sent1: She scrobbed the dishes until they sparkled.
meanings.sent2: The janitor scrobbed the floors every night.
meanings.sent3: He scrobbed the car so well, it looked brand new.
meanings.sent4: The determined cleaner scrobbed away the dirt like a superhero.
meanings.sent5: The image of her scrobbing the windows stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: To move or slide along a surface with a scraping or rubbing sound.
meanings.sent1: The chair scrobbed against the wooden floor as she pulled it out.
meanings.sent2: The cat scrobbed along the carpet, leaving a trail of fur.
meanings.sent3: The suitcase scrobbed noisily against the stairs as he dragged it up.
meanings.sent4: The old door scrobbed open, revealing a hidden room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the skateboard scrobbing on the pavement echoed in the alley.
